Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2007 06:15AM oilcandani wrote: I am THRILLED to let you all know that my mom's pathology reports were awesome!  She is stage one, slow growing.  Also, the cancer HAS NOT spread to the sentinel nodes!  She meets with her surgeon next week, and with an encologist shortly after.  Thank you for your support...I check in almost every day.  And best of luck and lots of hugs to all of the others dealing with the disease.  We'll get this monster beat yet!

Posts.Content: oilcandani wrote: My mother is 61, and was diagnosed 2 weeks ago.  She doesn't have much info about the stage or if it has spread.  She is having her left breast removed on Tuesday.  She has always been very small chested, so she decided to have implants done.  My question is..."should she have both breasts removed?"  They'll have to go in to her right breast anyway to add an implant.  I guess if it were me, I'd have the other breast removed as a precautionay thing.  There is no sign of cancer there at this point.  They plan to take lymph nodes, too.  So what if they remove the breast and find that the Cancer has spread?  Does that mean more surgery, or just chemo???  Ladies, please tell me what you know.  I want to give her as much info as possible in the next 24 hours. Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Remove both?? oilcandani Beesie

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2007 01:25PM oilcandani wrote: Thank you all for your wonderful insight.  My mom chose to have only the one breast removed.  So far, she's doing wonderfully!  This morning she could lift her arm straight up in the air!  She is taking a very low dosage of pain meds, so I'm sure that helped.  But as of right now, her spirits are up.  She has not shown any sign of depression since she got home yesterday.  It's almost scarey!  I'd be a basketcase!  Of course, she may be trying to show a strong side for my dad and I.  She'll see the plastic surgeon tomorrow to find out the next step for reconstructive surgery.  Hopefully, she'll hear the pathology report as well.  Again, thanks a million, ladies!  I will post again when I know more!   xoxo,  Dani
